title: How to become a writer, however my English is not good - Quora

response.answer_text: If you write each day it means you do the same thing writers do, which means you can call yourself a writer. If you do something each day or almost each day, if it’s a deliberate practice (you do it and you care about improving your skills, you analyse your mistakes and learn from them, you learn new stuff), you will improve with time, no doubt. When two years ago I started writing in English (not my first language) it would take me a lot more time than today to write a single post or answer on Quora. It was tedious! I had to look a lot of things up in a dictionary and still made a lot of mistakes (mistakes I didn’t even notice). But I shared this stuff anyway. When I think about some of my early posts or answers in English I feel embarrassed. I picture people reading those posts and seeing all those silly mistakes. Ugh! Whenever I notice such blunder I immediately eliminate it so that at least new readers don’t see them and can understand my point. I bet there are still plenty of them in my posts and answers. After almost two years of blogging in English daily (I started in January 2016) I feel way more confident, I make fewer mistakes (still make them but hope the ones I make nowadays are not that grave). Even if you suck at the beginning it doesn’t mean you‘ll always suck. That’s something people often don’t understand (not only haters and internet trolls who tell you you should do something else - all people). Someone who is really bad at singing can get better at it with time and practice. Someone who is really bad at taking pictures can get better at it with time and practice. Someone who is really bad at writing can get better at it with time and practice. In other words, you can be very bad at singing today, but how about two years from now? Don’t be easily dissuaded! Don’t give up after the first attempts! Soon you’ll get better at it. The belief (fact even) that you’re bad at something should never be an obstacle to doing it, especially if that’s what you enjoy doing. And most certainly people’s opinions and stingy, hateful comments should never be a reason for you to quit. - Part of it appeared in Lukasz Laniecki's post in Diary of an artist Lukasz Laniecki's post in Diary of an artist

Even for someone without strong English, to be a good writer, you need to do two things: read voraciously and write all he time. Both reading and writing will also help with your English. Take solace in the fact that there are many English-speaking people who write without good English. Of course, writing in your first language would be easier and could be translated to English.

Do you write well, tell a good story, get your point across, in your own language? That is the important part of “writing”. English grammar and spelling can be learned, the art not so much. I’ve tried several times to write books of mystery, science fiction, fantasy, and though I am a native English speaker, apparently I don’t tell a story very well. The language and the art are cousins, not twins.

If you want to become a writer the most important thing to do is to writing and writing. By writing essays or story writing you can improve your english.. I know it is not easy but i will be easier for you when u start practicing on it and day by day you will se improvement in your writing. And the other thing try to speak in english with your friend with your family or when you do chat on mobile phone try to write in english watch english movies with english subtitles.. Practice makes man perfecf So do practice and improve your self.

If you want to write in English, you will need to work on writing and language skills in order to communicate effectively. There are no shortcuts there. Reading a variety of books in English will help build those skills as well. A good editor can help after the writing is done—we all need that. Also, books do not have to be written in English—the world is rich in literature from many cultures.
